title: Could atonal music make someone cry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure! Why do you ask? All it means is that there isn’t an obvious home tonality. A couple of overtly atonal moments that brought tears to my eyes: Berg’s Violin Concerto The dance break from Cool from “West Side Story”, which is an atonal fugue with a 12-tone subject and 24-tone countersubject. There was a film adaptation of the Melville short story “Bartleby the Scrivener” that had a completely angular atonal score that I can’t track down presently, but it was heart-breaking. There are lots of film scores that use atonal techniques—too many to list.
